sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个形容词都有"每一个"之意。
means: each ： 指两个或两个以上中的每一个，强调个别。
every ： 指3个或3个以上的整体中的每一个，侧重于整体，与all接近。

sentence.Network_en: His voice was harsh as he enunciated each word carefully.
sentence.Network_cn: 他一字一顿，听上去很生硬。

sentence.Network_en: She planted a kiss on each of his leathery cheeks.
sentence.Network_cn: 她在他粗糙的面颊上左右各吻了一下。

sentence.Network_en: Try to support each other when one of you is feeling down.
sentence.Network_cn: 当有人觉得情绪低落时，要努力相互打气。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English æ̅lc; related to Dutch elk and German jeglich, based on a West Germanic phrase meaning ever alike' (see aye, alike)

encyclopedia.content: 程序 each (PHP 3, PHP 4, PHP 5) each -- 返回数组中当前的键/值对并将数组指针向前移动一步说明 array each ( array &array ) 返回 array 数组中当前指针位置的键/值对并向前移动数组指针。键值对被返回为四个单元的数组，键名为 0，1，key 和 value。单元 0 和 key 包含有数组单元的键名，1 和 value 包含有数据。 如果内部指针越过了数组的末端，则 each() 返回 FALSE。例子 1. each() 例子 <?php $foo = array("

entry.def: If you refer to each thing or  each person in a group, you are referring to every member of the group and considering them as individuals.

example.tran: 每本书都配有精美的插图。

example.ex: Each year, hundreds of animals are killed in this way...
example.tran: 每年都有数百只动物被这样杀掉。

entry.def: If you refer to each one of the members of a group, you are emphasizing that something applies to every one of them.

example.ex: He picked up forty of these publications and read each one of them.
example.tran: 他从这些出版物中挑选了40本，逐一阅读。

entry.def: You can refer to each and every member of a group to emphasize that you mean all the members of that group.

example.ex: Each and every person responsible for his murder will be brought to justice...
example.tran: 所有参与谋杀他的人都会被绳之以法。

example.ex: They can't destroy truth without destroying each and every one of us.
example.tran: 除非他们将我们赶尽杀绝，否则真理不灭。

entry.def: You use each other when you are saying that each member of a group does something to the others or has a particular connection with the others.

example.ex: We looked at each other in silence...
Both sides are willing to make allowances for each other's political sensitivities...
example.tran: 双方都愿意体谅彼此的政治敏感问题。

means.word_mean: 1. (used of count nouns) every one considered individually;
1. to or from every one of two or more (considered individually);

auth_sentence.content: What if we could read each other's minds?
auth_sentence.res_content: What if we could read each other's minds?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: What if we could read each other's minds?

auth_sentence.content: We will push each other to our own limits.
auth_sentence.res_content: We will push each other to our own limits.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We will push each other to our own limits.

auth_sentence.content: To serve, carve each Wellington into thick slices.
auth_sentence.res_content: To serve, carve each Wellington into thick slices.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: To serve, carve each Wellington into thick slices.

sentences.cn: 每一所学校都有图书馆。

sentences.en: Each one of us has his own duty.
sentences.cn: 我们每个人都有自己的职责。

sentences.en: Each boy and each girl works hard.

means.word_mean: 每个; （两个或两个以上的人或物中）各自, 各个, 每个

sentences.en: There were three students who called and I gave a book to each.
sentences.cn: 来了三个学生, 我发给每个人一本书。

sentences.en: Each of us has a company car.
sentences.cn: 我们每人都有一辆公司的汽车。

sentences.en: Each of you have to work together with one heart.
The witnesses were each perfectly certain of what they said.
sentences.cn: 证人们个个对自己所说的话十分肯定。

sentences.en: Peter and Bill each say they came first in the race.
sentences.cn: 彼得和比尔都说自己跑了第一。

sentences.en: The French and Germans each claimed the territory.
sentences.cn: 法国人和德国人都声称这块土地是他们的。

sentences.en: We each have our own particular tastes, haven't we?
sentences.cn: 我们各有所好, 不是吗?

sentences.en: They both hold each an opinion.

jushi.english: Each one of us has his own duty.
jushi.chinese: 我们每个人都有自己的职责。

jushi.english: Each boy and each girl works hard.

jushi.chinese: 每一所学校都有图书馆。
